content.description: Venus Rising is a nice problem on rounded rock. Pull up from a stand start on the undercling with strenuous moves to the top of the arete. The left arete is off but doesn't really seem to be tempting with the flow of the movement. A sit start adds a number to your 8a card, if that's your bag.
content.protection: One big pad will probably do it

content.description: Four move campus start goes at V4, V2 if you use the feet.
content.location: On non-lake side of trail across from Venus Rising.

content.description: Start with good sidepulls, hike your feet and throw for good hold.  Exit right.
content.location: Right off trail before you reach Venus Rising.

content.description: Same start as Left and Center variations, but move right.
content.location: Same start as Center but moves right.

content.description: SDS and pull up on large hold and move left to thin crack.  Fun and tricky.
content.location: Up past Venus Rising and right off the East Bluff Trail.

content.description: Stand start with decent holds and traverse right to top. Fun, and a good warm up.
content.location: Problem is left of Spotted Cow Left.

content.description: SDS on large hold at the bottom of the wall. Work your way up the thin face using a glassy crimp and some awkwardly placed feet. Throw for a good flake, breathe, then fight your way up a slopey topout.
content.location: Center of face just right of trail up past Venus Rising. Right in front of the tree.

content.description: The left arete of Shawn's Slab. A few fun moves to the top.
content.location: Left side of Shawn's Slab.

content.description: Climb up right side of slab, really fun and a good warm-up.
content.location: Just across from Spotted Cow Wall

content.description: Long reaches with thin feet. Do not use either arete. Start on balancey slap reach heigh for two jugs, move feet up the slick surface, reach high right for amazing pinch, work the feet high, and top out.
content.location: between Shawn's slab and Shawn's arete

content.description: Climb the cool slab arete next to the trail.
content.protection: A couple pads or more, a spot would be good, landing slants a bit
content.location: Right and clearly visible of the trail just before the monolith area.

content.description: Start from a crouch, with your left hand on a low side pull on the left side of the arÃªte, and your right on an obvious low side pull on the right.  Pull on and climb right wards to an easy mantle.  Spotters beware.  Detached blocks are not used for feet.
content.protection: 1-3 pads, spotter is key to prevent a possible bad fall off a ledge.
content.location: From the saddle between two obvious craggy features when walking to monolith (just before thunderbird bulge), drop down and left.  On the back side of the southern craggy feature, 40 feet from the trail you will see Precious.  The wrestling the bear boulder is just below.

content.description: Climb up pillar with good holds.  Good one to climb up for scrubbing the top of VR.
content.location: The pillar is a few feet left of Venus Rising.

content.description: Climb tall arete on block just right of Bark Biter.
content.location: To the right of Venus Rising and Bark Biter.

climbs.name: Just Another Sick Old New Rig Right

content.description: SDS on the obvious low jug. Move up-and-right through pocket to top.
content.location: The obvious arete on the tier just below The Haunting.

climbs.name: Just Another Sick Old New Rig Left

content.description: SDS on the obvious low jug. Move up-and-left through slopers to top.
content.location: The obvious arete on the tier just below The Haunting.

content.description: Start sitting on a tree on the left side of the spotted cow wall, left hand on a good hold, right on a sidepull.  Traverse low into the start of spotted cow center and finish it up.  The last move is a kicker.
content.location: Spotted cow wall, next to the east bluff trail, just south of Venus Rising.

content.description: From a sit with your left hand on a slopey sidepull and your right on an undercling, climb up the face through a pocket hold.
content.location: This is on a pedestal facing Venus rising and climbs the face right of a dihedral.

content.description: Climb up the slightly overhanging wall on good holds.
content.location: Immediately left of The Haunting.

content.description: This is a fun body tension problem. The minimal feet combined with a great hand rail makes this climb strong for the grade. Bring your muscles!
content.location: The climb starts on the boulder just right of the Broken Pottery routes. The rock below the crack is not on, only use feet on the upper block! Both hands start on the arete with a high right foot, then reach around to the good hand rail

content.description: Starts in the cave to the right of the V1 slab.  Starts left hand on the sloper shelf in the center of the wall and right on a wide pinch near the right arete in the back of the cave.  Traverse left to the arete.  Continue up the arete and top out.
content.protection: Pad, and someone to make sure you don't dry fire into the wall behind you
content.location: Monolith area, same corridor as Venus Rising/Bark Biter.  On the same boulder as, "Boulder right of bark biter"

content.description: Start on ledge in right corner of "cave". Climb hand crack and hanging corner to top.
content.protection: A fall would be less than ideal.
content.location: In the alcove behind the Boulder Right of Barkbiter. Across from Claustrophobia

content.description: Start on chockstone in the back of the "cave". Climb the wide crack to the top.
content.protection: A fall would be less than ideal.
content.location: In the alcove behind the Boulder Right of Barkbiter.

content.description: Start seated near the left arete of the boulder. Use the wide crack for a few moves and top out.
content.location: On the southern most part of the Monolith Ridge East Side. On the left side of the arete on the stand alone boulder to the right of the Spotted Cow Right (V2).

content.description: Start seated and use good face holds to a rounding top out.
content.location: On the southern most part of the Monolith Ridge East Side. On the face of the stand alone boulder to the right of the Spotted Cow Right (V2).

content.description: From a sit, with your left hand on the lowest part of an obvious slopey shelf and your right on a good spot low on the arÃªte, pull on and climb up and right out of the corridor.  A confined problem with fun moves.
content.location: To the right of Venus rising in a the back of a corridor.  This starts the same as el nino.

content.description:
SDS on shelf with right hand on good side pull and left on a sloper on the face of the boulder. Mantle and climb up the face. The arete is off. No credit if you sit on a crash pad. 

  Admin adds: It should be noted that this is an SDS to Boulder right of Bark Biter.
content.location: On the other side of El Nino, to the right of Venus Rising.

content.description: Starting up right side of face, find hidden hold and move up and left to top.
content.location: Just around corner from Shawn's Slab.

content.description: Same as Right version, but avoid the hidden hold.
content.location: Face just right of Shawn's Slab.

content.description: 17 Feet. This isn't in any published guide but it's a pretty fun problem. It's located right next to Bark Biter. Start on the small platform at the bottom and climb up the face starting with a hidden hold pointed to by the green arrow. Aside from the start, stay off the left arete. Using the hidden hold, probably a V0-V1. Without using the hidden hold will be a bit trickier, probably V2. Sorry for the vague ratings, I suck at rating climbs.

12 Feet. Climb the crack on the right side of the arete avoiding the generous corner on the far right. Really really really watch out for that tree. Above 1/2 of the way up, any fall you make will result in an unwanted slide with your back down the tree, and eventually face planting back into the rock.
Across the slight gully left of Shawn's Slab Arete. Climb up over center of the bulge. Avoid using the obvious, large, hollow-sounding flake (labelled "DEATH FLAKE" on the topo photo) on the left.
content.location: Left of Shawn's Slab Arete.

content.description: Climb the face and thin crack just left of Broken Pottery Left.
content.location: Left side of Broken Pottery Wall.

content.description: 12 feet. Climb using both sides of the arete. There are hidden holds on the left side, and you can use some of the holds on Venus Rising (route 59).

This is a nice bouldering area with a high density of high-quality problems.

 These problems are just above the trail (west of the trail, but east of the ridgeline). Â Be courteous to the many hikers who pass through here.
